title: Home
content: Home This is a place to put my SEC-110 notes & tech journals.

title: Day 1 Notes
content:
Date: 1/14/2026
Instructor: LaKysha Patnode
Lecture Slides: [[Module 1 What is Cybersecurity.pdf]]
Module #:
Notes

don't hack each other
extra credit can be applied to assignments you didn't do great on to bring the grade up
We wont get through the class activities completely in class due to time, however well work through the most technical parts
setup email forwarding from Champlain email to EHS email
use GitHub wiki page (?) for notes and tech journal, well also submit some assignments through the GitHub wiki page. need to add instructor as collaborator on it
an appointment is needed to get office hours
Syllabus: [[SEC-110-71_ Cybersecurity Fundamentals Syllabus-1.pdf]]

grade %s

assignments 40% of grade
Class activities 25% of grade
Quizzes & tests 10% of grade - low percentage because they are to check where you're at
Engagement 10% - interacting in class and with materials outside of class
Final Project 15%

Late policy

let her know ahead of time if you wont be able to be on time
if you don't show up for 2 weeks in a row, and don't tell her, it is an automatic F
email her if its late, she might remove the deduction
late is 20% of grade taken off
if you cant email her, its better to get it in on time and incomplete than it is to get it in late
assignments for week 7 wont be accepted after week 7

title: SEC-110
content:
This is the Homepage for Tech Journals & Notes
Week 1: What is Cybersecurity?

Week 2: Intro to VMs / Intro to Kali

Week 3: Risk, Adversaries, and Threats

Week 4: Human Factors and Bias

Week 5: Data Security

Week 6: System Security

Week 7: Cryptography Basics

Week 8: Spring Break (NO CLASS)

Spring break.

Week 9: Hashing & Modern Ciphers

Week 10: Networking Basics

Week 11: Network Security

Week 12: Web Fundamentals

Week 13: Web Security

Week 14: Digital Investigations

Week 15: Final Project & Quiz 3
